thread.title: Ken Clarke: 'Tone of Theresa May's speech was all wrong'
thread.title_full: Ken Clarke: 'Tone of Theresa May's speech was all wrong' - BBC News

author: BBC
title: Ken Clarke: 'Tone of Theresa May's speech was all wrong'
text:
Media playback is unsupported on your device Ken Clarke: 'Tone of Theresa May's speech was all wrong' 11 October 2015 Last updated at 10:01 BST
The tone of Theresa May's party conference speech on immigration was "all, all wrong" according to Conservative heavyweight MP Ken Clarke.
The home secretary unveiled a reform of the asylum rules, pledged to reduce the numbers claiming in Britain and said high migration made a "cohesive society" impossible.
The former cabinet minister told The Andrew Marr Show he was a fan Mrs May but said Britain had a "tradition of giving refuge to people fleeing from war".
Read more Theresa May pledges asylum reform and immigration crackdown
